meanings.definition: The study of manuscripts as physical objects.
meanings.sent1: In codicology, researchers examine old books to learn about their history.
meanings.sent2: She decided to pursue codicology to understand ancient texts better.
meanings.sent3: The codicology class had students carefully handling delicate manuscripts.
meanings.sent4: His passion for codicology turned him into a detective of ancient books.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of codicology lies in unraveling the secrets hidden within old manuscripts.

meanings.definition: The analysis of the materials and techniques used in creating manuscripts.
meanings.sent1: Codicology involves identifying the materials used in making manuscripts.
meanings.sent2: The codicology expert could determine the age of a manuscript by its materials.
meanings.sent3: The codicology workshop taught students how to spot forgeries.
meanings.sent4: Her attention to detail in codicology made her an expert in manuscript authentication.
meanings.sent5: The precision required in codicology is akin to solving a complex puzzle.
